intro: Sida retusa, commonly known as rough sida, is an herbaceous annual plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, yellow flowers are typically clustered in racemes, and it produces capsules containing numerous small seeds. Sida retusa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
